title: Build issue: ParaView build fails at llvm 9.0.0 with intel/19.0.4, compiler does not support c++11
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install paraview@5.6.2%intel@19.0.4 +osmesa~opengl2+python3+plugins ^freetype@2.7 ^hdf5@1.10.2 ^openblas@0.3.6 ^openssl@1.0.2o ^cmake@3.15.3 ^llvm~internal_unwind
  >> 356    CMake Error at projects/libcxx/CMakeLists.txt:537 (message):
     357      C++11 or greater is required but the compiler does not support c++11
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux sn-fey1.lanl.gov 3.10.0-1062.1.1.1chaos.ch6.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 4 16:09:20 PDT 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.7 (Maipo)
```

- Relevant `compilers.yaml` portion:
```yaml
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
      cflags: -Wl,-rpath,/usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/lib/intel64_lin
      cxxflags: -Wl,-rpath,/usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/lib/intel64_lin
      fflags: -Wl,-rpath,/usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/lib/intel64_lin
    modules: [intel/19.0.4]
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/bin/intel64/icc
      cxx: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/bin/intel64/icpc
      f77: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/bin/intel64/ifort
      fc: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/bin/intel64/ifort
    spec: intel@19.0.4
    target: x86_64
```

### Additional information

I am at commit fcc9a668bf6d72ffd40280fa37d6bb8ee6bc6d01 with this spack.

The error above occurs in the cmake step for llvm.

@chuckatkins @danlipsa do you have any guidance for solving this?
